newsitem.title: UK: UK meals and feeds stay away despite lower prices.
newsitem.headline: UK meals and feeds stay away despite lower prices.

text.p: Buyers were conspicuous by there absence on the UK meals and feeds market on Tuesday despite sharply lower high protein soymeal prices.
High pro ex-mill and ex-stores was as much as six stg down with reports of some sellers seven to eight stg lower in the near months.
The sharp falls were triggered by a collapse in soybean futures on the Chicago market following news that the USDA had left it's soybean carryover figure unchanged at 125 million bushels.
"You would have thought that buyers would have jumped in with both feet this morning, but they are still very cautious," said one broker.
Only one trade was reported when high pro soymeal fetched 223.50 stg a tonne for spot ex-store Southampton.
Rapemeal was unchanged ex-mill Erith while the Liverpool and Hull mills were one stg lower.
Most other sectors of the market were unchanged.
